data.title: ASCII Tetromino Rotator
data.solution:
# Read the 4x4 grid
grid = []
for _ in range(4):
    grid.append(input())

# Create a new empty grid
rotated = [['.' for _ in range(4)] for _ in range(4)]

# Find all '#' positions and rotate them
for row in range(4):
    for col in range(4):
        if grid[row][col] == '#':
            # For 90Â° counterclockwise rotation:
            new_row = 3 - col
            new_col = row
            rotated[new_row][new_col] = '#'

# Print the rotated grid
for row in rotated:
    print(''.join(row))
data.statement:
You receive an ASCII representation of a tetromino (a geometric shape composed of 4 squares) made of {{#}} characters. Your task is to rotate it 90 degrees anticlockwise.

The tetromino is contained in a 4x4 grid where empty spaces are represented by dots ({{.}}).
data.constraints:
- Input will always be 4x4
- Input will always contain exactly 4 {{#}} characters
- Input will always represent a valid tetromino (all {{#}} are connected)
data.stubGenerator:
loop 4 read line:string(4)
loop 4 write answer

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You receive an ASCII representation of a tetromino (a geometric shape composed of 4 squares) made of # characters. Your task is to rotate it 90 degrees anticlockwise.

The tetromino is contained in a 4x4 grid where empty spaces are represented by dots (.).
Input
4 lines: A 4x4 grid representing the tetromino, where:
- # represents a filled square
- . represents an empty space
Output
4 lines: The tetromino rotated 90 degrees anticlockwise
Constraints
- Input will always be 4x4
- Input will always contain exactly 4 # characters
- Input will always represent a valid tetromino (all # are connected)
Example
Input
....
.##.
.#..
.#..
Output
....
.#..
.###
....
